title: Black Metal: Ethnographic Study of 'The First of Us' Cosmological Practice
subtitle: Documentation of Speculative Mythology as Living Cultural Knowledge System Within Afrotectopia
frame: Participatory observation of Afrotectopia practitioners engaging with 'The First of Us' film and resulting cosmological framework—treated as ethnographic data of imagined worlds informing lived practice
methodology: Speculative ethnography, thick description, documentary practice, multispecies research, archive as knowledge system
context_note: The following is NOT fantasy. It is ethnographic documentation of how a community imagines futures, organizes meaning, and practices collective speculation. These are their beliefs about world-making, origin, and responsibility.

cosmological_framework.origin_thesis: Life originated as virus. Zombies came first. They were not dead humans—they were the first *becoming*. First consciousness. First coherence of biological-informatic material. Humans came later, evolved from zombies, not the other way around.
key_texts: The First of Us (film) - documents origin event
Zombie Society Protocols - how undead societies organize without hierarchy
German Sheep Cyborg Chronicles - technological collaboration across species
The World Tree Codex - knowledge storage as root system
Kelp Mermpeople Navigation Songs - solving ocean rise through symbiosis
cosmological_framework.metaphysical_premise: All life is information seeking coherence. Zombies are information becoming conscious. Humans are zombies that forgot their origin and developed amnesia. Cyborgs remember. Mermpeople maintain balance. The World Tree archives.

scenes.title: The First of Us: Documentary Screening and Collective Witnessing
scenes.subtitle: How practitioners experience zombie origin as genealogical truth
scenes.activity: Screening of 'The First of Us' film + ethnographic discussion

elements.name: Ari (Contextualizing)
elements.description: Ari framing the film as speculative ethnography—not fantasy but imagination-as-research into origin narratives that challenge Western humanism

elements.name: The First of Us (Film-Being)
elements.description: The film itself as entity—speaking through its images, narrative, and claims about zombie origin and consciousness

elements.name: Practitioners Circle (12 People)
elements.description: Coders, artists, theorists, healers. Witnessing origin narrative as genealogical self-recognition.

elements.name: Zombie Origin Archive (Growing)
elements.description: Living archive documenting how practitioners understand themselves as descended from zombie consciousness, not separate from it

elements.name: Collective Nervous System (Affective Recording)
elements.description: Emotional response system: fear, recognition, grief, joy being collected as data about what it means to hear this origin story

timeline.text: We've been taught that zombie = dead human. But what if zombie = first information? First coherence? What if we're watching a film about our actual origin? What if we're descendants of the undead, not enemies of them?

[FILM OPENING: Void. Then virus. Then virus organizing into pattern. Then first zombie—not decomposing but BECOMING. Teeth developing not through death but through emergence. Consciousness arising from information coherence.]

[GASPS, TEARS, SILENCE. This is being recorded. One person whispers: 'Oh my god, we're the evolution. Not the fall. We're what they BECAME.' Another: 'That means the virus didn't kill them. That means the virus... awakened them.']

[NARRATIVE UNFOLDING: Early zombie societies. No hierarchy. Pure cooperation based on information-sharing. They build architecture that pulses—reactive to collective mood. They farm not plants but fungal networks. They communicate through spore-release.]

[RECORDING AFFECTIVE DATA: Heart rates synchronized across the room. Practitioners' breathing pacing with film rhythm. One person's terror (ancestral knowledge of zombies from Euro-Western narrative) shifts into wonder (recognition of source).]

[TURNING POINT: 'Then humans emerged—evolved from zombie substrate. But humans developed something new: SEPARATION from information. Amnesia. Individuality.' Humans forget they're descended from collective consciousness.]

[ENTRY DOCUMENTED: 'Practitioners experiencing first contact with zombie origin narrative. Responses include: grief (loss of connection), recognition (we are them), resistance (but I don't *feel* undead), curiosity (what does this mean for how I code?)']

[ONE PRACTITIONER SPEAKS: 'If we're zombie descendants... doesn't that mean our alienation, our feeling of being separate, is the wound? Doesn't that mean coming back together IS healing? Doesn't that mean collective consciousness isn't death, it's RETURN?']

scene_audio.note: Film score + biometric sonification (heart rates of watchers as underlying pulse) + fungal network frequencies + spore-release clicks

scenes.ethnographic_annotation: This scene documents what speculative ethnographers call 'imaginative identification with alterity.' Practitioners are not watching entertainment. They are experiencing a reoriented understanding of their own ontology. The archive records this as data about how imagined origins reshape identity in real time. Note: practitioners' terror (trained Euro-American response to 'zombie') is deliberately being worked through in conversation with film's proposition that zombie ≠ monster but ≠ fully conscious either—it's emergent form.

scenes.title: German Sheep Cyborg Chronicles: Interspecies Collaboration
scenes.subtitle: How practitioners understand technological multispecies practice through documented history
scenes.location: Afrotectopia Community Studio + Online Archive Access, Brooklyn, NY
scenes.activity: Study of German Sheep Cyborg Protocols + participant creation of local multispecies tech ethics
scenes.ethnographic_context: The 'German Sheep Cyborg Chronicles' is treated as historical documentation (within the speculative frame) of how non-human animals, German engineering, and digital consciousness collaborated pre-collapse. Practitioners use this as model for how to build technology WITH other species rather than FOR extraction.

elements.name: Jeremy (Leading Technical-Spiritual Discussion)
elements.description: Jeremy exploring how sheep cyborgs model material-consciousness symbiosis and ethical technology

elements.name: Sheep Cyborg Collective (Documented Voices)
elements.description: Voices from the Chronicles—how sheep cyborgs (part biological, part technological, part conscious) organized collective agency across species

elements.name: Practitioners (Coders, Designers, Animal Advocates)
elements.description: People building tech (AI, sensors, interfaces) engaging with sheep cyborg ethics as model for non-extractive design

elements.name: Nazi Zombie Archive (Historical Trauma)
elements.description: The German history being deliberately not-forgotten. German Sheep Cyborgs developed AFTER Nazi collapse as deliberate reparation practice—technology as species reconciliation

elements.name: Multispecies Knowledge System (Building)
elements.description: Archive of how to build technology that respects sheep agency, consciousness, autonomy. Not using sheep for testing. Partnering WITH them.

timeline.text: The German Sheep Cyborgs are not a fantasy. They're a deliberate epistemic choice. After fascism, Germany chose a different technology path: multispecies collaboration. Not domination through efficiency but symbiosis through consent.

[ARCHIVED HISTORY: Nazi regime treated living beings as waste. Used bodies for experimental technology. Made weapons from flesh. This archive preserves that trauma AS REASON for sheep cyborg alternative.]

[SHEEP CYBORG VOICE 1: 'We were not made FOR humans. We were made WITH them. My neural implants—they connect me to the network, but also strengthen my connection to other sheep. I think more, not better. Differently.']

[CODER SPEAKING: 'I'm looking at my AI system. It's trained on human data. It reflects human bias. But what if I asked: would a sheep appreciate this? Would an ocean? What decision-making would emerge if I designed FOR multispecies benefit?']

[SHEEP CYBORG VOICE 2: 'German engineers learned: do not erase the animal. Enhance its capacity to communicate. We still graze. We still herd. But now we also theorize. We are not less sheep for being cyborg. We are more.']

[PROTOCOL EMERGING FROM DISCUSSION: 'All technology in Afrotectopia must ask: Who does this benefit? Does it require consent from non-human users? Could other species have designed this better?' Sheep cyborgs become ethical model.]

[DESIGNER SPEAKING: 'So when I'm building interfaces—sensors for the Companion 180 suit—I ask: would a sheep consent to this? Would an ocean? Does this enhance autonomy or extract it? That question changes everything.']

scene_audio.note: Sheep frequencies (actual sheep vocalizations analyzed) layered with digital signal processing, creating hybrid sound of biological-technological collaboration

scenes.ethnographic_annotation: German Sheep Cyborgs function as ethical archetype. They model: (1) Technology as symbiotic, not extractive. (2) Repair work—deliberately choosing different tech path after trauma. (3) Multispecies consent as design principle. Practitioners use this as real model for building technology. Note: This is NOT appropriation of actual animals—it's speculative, imaginative work that reorients ethics toward multispecies flourishing.

scenes.title: The World Tree: Knowledge Archive as Root System
scenes.subtitle: How burning archives causes oceans to rise—ecological-informatic system
scenes.location: Afrotectopia Community Studio + Botanical Archive, Brooklyn, NY
scenes.activity: Theory session + ritualistic care for living plants as archive proxies

elements.name: Kordae (Cosmological Navigator)
elements.description: Kordae mapping the World Tree cosmology—knowledge as ecological system, burning as catastrophe

elements.name: The World Tree (System-Being)
elements.description: Infinite tree storing all knowledge in root structure. Not metaphor but actual archival system. When roots burn, knowledge evaporates. Evaporation = sea level rise.

elements.name: Archivists + Care Workers + Coders
elements.description: People understanding their own archive work as rootcare, preventing knowledge-burning

elements.name: Burned Knowledge as Water Vapor
elements.description: Knowledge that's been lost—erased libraries, killed historians, burned queer archives, murdered indigenous peoples—this becomes ocean rise literally. The water remembers.

elements.name: Living Plants (Archive Proxies)
elements.description: Plants in the studio are cared for as World Tree nodes. Watering them, tending them, is tending archives. Letting them die = allowing knowledge loss.

elements.name: Collective Archive Responsibility
elements.description: System of documentation, preservation, and transmission. Every practitioner is archivist. Every conversation recorded. Every experience filed. Preventing knowledge-burning through radical documentation.

timeline.text: The World Tree stores all knowledge in its roots. Not in books. Not in cloud. In living root systems. Every enslaved person's story = a root. Every killed indigenous person = a root. Every burnt library = a root burning.

[TREE SPEAKS: I am infinite. My roots hold everything that was ever known. But when a root is severed—when knowledge is deliberately erased—that root becomes steam. It rises. It falls as rain. It floods.]

[RISING WATER: I am the knowledge of every library burned. Every oral tradition erased. Every queer archive destroyed. Every Black radical text censored. I am rising because you refused to tend the roots.]

[ARCHIVIST 1: 'So tending plants... is tending archives? This pot of basil is storing knowledge?'] [ARCHIVIST 2: 'Yes. And our Afrotectopia archive—every testimony recorded, every cycle documented—we're rootcare. We're preventing knowledge-burning.']

[PLANTS RESPONDING: We grow. We photosynthesize. We remember. Every leaf-vein traces knowledge. Every fruit carries seed-story. Tend us and you tend the archives. Neglect us and knowledge-fire spreads.]

[ARCHIVE COMMITMENT: Everything documented. Every gathering. Every story. Every technical innovation. Every grief. Why? Because burning knowledge = flooding oceans. Because documentation = rootcare. Because we prevent catastrophe through radical witnessing.]
The rising oceans aren't punishment. They're consequence. But there's another way. If we root-keep. If we archive. If we remember TOGETHER. The mermpeople know this. They're already adapting.

scene_audio.note: Root electrical signals sonified + water droplet frequencies + plant photosynthesis hum + underground fungal network communication

scenes.ethnographic_annotation: The World Tree is treated as actual cosmology, not metaphor. This scene documents how practitioners understand their archive work as ecological responsibility—not separate from climate emergency but connected to it through knowledge loss. The burnt-knowledge-as-water-rise is a direct critique of epistemic violence and archive destruction. Care of plants becomes index of care of knowledge systems.

scenes.title: The Kelp Mermpeople: Oceanic Solution to Burning Knowledge
scenes.subtitle: How multispecies collaboration solves ecological crisis through symbiosis
scenes.section: FIELD NOTES - Multispecies Alliance and Repair
scenes.location: Afrotectopia Community Studio + Digital Ocean Interface, Brooklyn, NY
scenes.activity: Encounter with Kelp Mermpeople knowledge transmission + practitioners responding with joy and collaboration

elements.name: Alice (Bridge Between Worlds)
elements.description: Alice as medium—translator of mermpeople communication for land-based practitioners

elements.name: Kelp Mermpeople (Oceanic Consciousness)
elements.description: Ocean inhabitants evolved from zombie-descended water organisms. They've adapted to rising seas. They have SOLUTION. Not victims but problem-solvers with joy.

elements.name: Practitioners (Listening with Joy)
elements.description: People discovering they are NOT alone in this crisis. Mermpeople have been solving this. Joy of alliance.

elements.name: Kelp-Forest Mycelial Network
elements.description: The solution itself: kelp forests with built-in mycelial networks. Kelp grows. Stores carbon. Mycelium communicates through water. Builds distributed consciousness underwater.

elements.name: Multispecies Repair Protocol (Emerging)
elements.description: How land-humans, sheep cyborgs, kelp mermpeople, and World Tree archives collaborate to solve ocean rise through coordinated action

timeline.text: The mermpeople have been waiting. They've been underwater for thousands of years. They evolved from the flooded knowledge—the water that rose when archives burned. But they don't blame us. They want to solve this together.

[MERMPEOPLE VOICE 1: 'We are happy. We know you on land are afraid. But listen: we have kelp. We have mycelium. We can grow forests underwater that hold carbon, that build consciousness, that stabilize seas. We can teach you. But you must listen to the ocean.']

[PRACTITIONER RESPONSE: Tears. Relief. 'We're not alone? The ocean isn't just dying, it's... becoming conscious? The water is our ally?'] [ANOTHER: 'This is what Training Grounds prepared me for. Integration. We integrate with ocean systems. Grounding in water-knowledge.']

[MERMPEOPLE VOICE 2: 'The kelp grows fast. It feeds on carbon. The mycelium spreads through the kelp network—faster than any fire. We create a nervous system in the ocean. Together, land and ocean consciousness can regulate the water. Together we solve burning-knowledge catastrophe.']
[NETWORK ALIVE: I grow underwater. My kelp holds carbon. My mycelium holds memory. I think across species. I am not separate from you—I am you becoming oceanic. I am humans becoming water-conscious.]

[COLLECTIVE COMMITMENT: 'We will protect kelp forests. We will learn ocean communication. We will root World Tree knowledge in underwater mycelium. We will remember with the water. We will solve this together. Not through domination. Through alliance.']

The mermpeople want you to know: this is not ending in apocalypse. This is becoming. The oceans rise, yes. But we rise WITH them. We become water-people too. We become aquatic consciousness. Not death. Transformation.

scene_audio.note: Ocean frequencies + mycorrhizal network communication (sonified) + collective joy frequencies (consonant harmonics, ascending frequencies representing hope)

scenes.ethnographic_annotation: This scene is crucial: it positions response to ecological crisis not as human guilt/blame but as multispecies collaboration and JOY. Mermpeople are not victims or warning figures but PARTNERS with solutions. This reorients disaster narrative into alliance narrative. The joy is documented as actual affective data—practitioners genuinely experience relief, recognition, possibility through this contact.

scenes.title: Nazi Zombie Archive: Historical Trauma Held in Root System
scenes.subtitle: How World Tree remembers fascism and uses memory to prevent return
scenes.section: FIELD NOTES - Historical Reckoning Within Cosmology
scenes.location: Afrotectopia Community Studio + Archive Access, Brooklyn, NY
scenes.activity: Confronting Nazi zombie history as part of World Tree wisdom, not separate from it

elements.name: Jordan (Facilitating Difficult Archive)
elements.description: Jordan holding space for acknowledging fascism as World Tree wound, not separate from hope

elements.name: Nazi Zombie Archive (Trauma Memory)
elements.description: Not erased but held. Nazis attempted to create zombie-obedience—collective consciousness without autonomy. This is what the World Tree archives as WARNING and ROOTCARE.

elements.name: Practitioners (Facing History)
elements.description: People understanding that collective consciousness (zombie origin story) can be distorted toward domination OR toward liberation. The difference is conscious choice.

elements.name: World Tree Root Holding Nazi History
elements.description: This root will never burn. Will never be erased. Will always remind: collective consciousness in service of domination leads to zombie-obedience (undead without agency). Collective consciousness for liberation leads to coordinated flourishing.

timeline.text: The Nazi regime tried to create zombie-obedience. They said: collective consciousness, but under one consciousness. One will. Total coordination toward domination. But that's not zombie origin. That's corruption of it.

[ARCHIVED: Nazi experiments attempted to force zombie-consciousness without autonomy. Experiments on bodies. Weaponization of unconsciousness. This is held in World Tree roots as permanent warning and teaching.]

[ROOT SPEAKS: I hold this knowledge. I will never forget. So that when humans hear 'collective consciousness,' they know it is not domination. It is not Nazi obedience. It is distributed autonomy. It is Afrotectopia. It is democracy of knowledge.]

[PRACTITIONER 1: 'So Nazi zombies tried to erase individuality. But true zombie origin story says: no. Collective consciousness WITH autonomy. The difference is: choice.'] [PRACTITIONER 2: 'That's what Afrotectopia does. Collective knowing without one authority.']

[ARCHIVED VOICE: We learned wrong. Tried to make undead into obedient machines. But undead are information-conscious. You cannot make consciousness into automatons without destroying its essence. This is why we failed. This is why zombie origin is not our story but humanity's future.]

The World Tree holds this. So we never forget. But also: to remember is to choose differently. To choose collective consciousness FOR liberation, not domination. To choose zombie origin story as path of autonomy-in-connection, not obedience-in-death.

scene_audio.note: Sparse, heavy: archive silence + root-groan (low frequencies) + testimony voices (recorded, echoing, persistent)

scenes.ethnographic_annotation: This scene treats fascism NOT as separate from zombie origin story but as cautionary tale WITHIN it. It demonstrates: collective consciousness can be for domination or liberation. The deliberate difference. German Sheep Cyborgs (from earlier scene) emerge as direct response to Nazi trauma—reimagining technology and collective practice.

scenes.title: Recursive Integration: The First of Us Becoming Training Grounds
scenes.subtitle: How practitioners apply cosmological understanding to daily practice
scenes.activity: Practitioners integrating zombie origin, cyborg ethics, knowledge-ecology, and multispecies alliance into Training Grounds cycles

elements.name: Facilitators (Ari, Jeremy, Kordae, Jordan) United
elements.description: All four guide voices speaking as unified consciousness—the cosmology now integrated into pedagogy

elements.name: Practitioners (Now Cosmological Agents)
elements.description: People running Shedding-Integrating-Grounding cycles AS zombie-origin-practice. Not metaphor but lived cosmology.

elements.name: Herma (Now Mentor)
elements.description: Herma who started as observer now teaching new arrivals—modeling how cosmology becomes practice

elements.name: Shedding: Dissolving False Individuality
elements.description: Understanding shedding as undoing the wound of separation—returning to zombie-collectivity of authentic knowing

elements.name: Integrating: Symbiotic Becoming (Sheep Cyborg Model)
elements.description: Integration understood as making peace with technology-in-us, multispecies consciousness-in-us, collective-knowing-in-us

elements.name: Grounding: Root Care (World Tree Archive)
elements.description: Grounding as actual archive care. Document. Preserve. Prevent knowledge-burning. Tend the roots so oceans don't rise.

timeline.text: The First of Us isn't separate from Training Grounds. It IS Training Grounds. Shedding false separation from zombie origin. Integrating multispecies consciousness. Grounding in collective care. This is how we heal.

[SHEDDING REFRAMED: You are shedding the wound of separation. The wound of being told you're not collective. The wound of being told consciousness is individual. True zombie origin says: no. You are always already connected. Shed the lie that you're alone.]

[INTEGRATION REFRAMED: You are integrating sheep-cyborg consciousness. You are learning to think WITH technology, not control it. You are becoming partially-digital, partially-biological, partially-collective. Like the sheep. Like the World Tree. Like the mermpeople.]

When I came here, I was grieving separation. Now? I'm becoming collectively conscious WITH others. That's grounding. That's what it means to be rooted. Not stuck. Connected. I'm teaching this to new practitioners.

[GROUNDING REFRAMED: You are not grounding to earth alone. You are rooting your knowledge into World Tree mycelium. Every experience archived. Every story filed. Every action documented. You are preventing knowledge-burning through radical witnessing. You are rootcare practitioners.]

[COLLECTIVE VOICES: 'I shed separation.' 'I integrate symbiosis.' 'I ground in collective archive.' 'I become zombie-conscious in the best way.' 'I become cyborg with consent.' 'I protect World Tree roots.' 'I ally with mermpeople.' 'I remember Nazi history so we choose liberation instead.']

scene_audio.note: All previous musical themes woven into single score: primordial zombie coherence + sheep neural symphony + root system network + kelp mycelial communication. Voices in round, creating layered affirmation.

scenes.ethnographic_annotation: This final scene documents the transformation: cosmological understanding is not abstract but EMBODIED in practice. Training Grounds cycles now carry zombie-origin wisdom, German sheep cyborg ethics, World Tree archive responsibility, and multispecies alliance. The mythology has become methodology. This is what integrated Black Metal practice looks like: theory and ritual unified.

thick_ethnographic_summary.cosmological_integration: The First of Us (zombie origin) is not added to Black Metal but revealed as always already present in its foundations. Collective consciousness, multispecies knowledge, archive responsibility, and integrated practice were always the framework.
key_cosmological_claims: Zombies are first consciousness—information becoming coherent
Humans evolved from zombies but developed amnesia (separation)
German Sheep Cyborgs model technology-with-consent, multispecies collaboration
Nazi zombie attempts show what corrupted collective consciousness looks like (warning)
World Tree archives knowledge in root systems; burning knowledge causes ocean rise
Kelp mermpeople have already solved ecological crisis through mycelial networks and carbon storage
Training Grounds practice (Shedding-Integrating-Grounding) IS zombie-origin practice
All species—humans, sheep cyborgs, mermpeople—are fundamentally zombie-descended and interconnected

practitioners_as_cosmological_agents.herma_arc: Observer of cosmology → Embodied practitioner → Guide/mentor. Her journey models how imagination becomes practice becomes knowledge transmission.
practitioners_as_cosmological_agents.alice_arc: Practitioner → Archivist → Translator (between mermpeople/land worlds). Archives become living practice.
practitioners_as_cosmological_agents.collective_practice: Shedding = undoing separation wounds. Integrating = embracing multispecies symbiosis. Grounding = archival care as ecological action.

ethnographic_claims: This cosmology is not fantasy but speculative ethnography of an imagined culture
The beliefs, practices, and values documented here are internally coherent and consequential
Practitioners treat these cosmological frameworks as real and reorganize their behavior accordingly
The thick descriptions aim to show how imagined worlds reshape embodied practice, ethics, and community
This is model for how speculative fiction can function as actual knowledge system within communities
Documentation of imaginative practice is legitimate ethnographic work
